entry.title: How can i use a component of a table parameter of a BAPI as an Result Data Object in BRF+?
entry.content:
Hello experts,

i would like to use a component of a table of a BAPI as an Result Data Object in BRF+.

The BAPI is: BAPI_BUPA_ADDRESS_GETDETAIL
And i would like to have the component E_MAIL of the table parameter BAPIADSMTP as the Result Data Object of the BRF+ Expression.

There are some screenshots of my BRF+ Expression. I'm using a procedure call.

I've created a table Data Object with the structure of BAPIADSMTP and used E_MAIL as Result Data Object and also as assigned value. This did not work.

This is the Table Data Object that i have created:

Is it even possible to use a component of a table parameter as an result data object? ..or do i have to modify the BAPI to do so?

Thank you so much for your help!

entry.title: Why Are BRF+ Objects Inactive After Transporting from Development to Quality in SAP S/4HANA?
entry.content:
Introduction

Business Rule Framework Plus (BRF+) is a powerful tool in SAP S/4HANA for defining business rules and decision logic. However, when transporting BRF+ applications across different system landscapes, several challenges can arise. I am currently facing a transport issue when moving BRF+ applications for Quotation and another determination output from the Development system to Quality and would appreciate any input from the SAP Community.

Issue Details

Step 1: Import the Standard BRF+ XML File

  • Imported the standard BRF+ XML file for Quotation and another determination output into the Development system.

  • Verified that all objects (Functions, Rules, Expressions, etc.) were correctly imported.

Step 2: Activation and Transport Capture

  • Activated all the imported objects successfully in the Development system.

  • Ensured that all objects were captured in a transport request using SE09.

Step 3: Transport to Quality System

  • Transported the BRF+ application from Development to Quality.

  • However, after import, all objects in the Quality system appear inactive.

Step 4: Re-Capturing and Re-Transporting

  • Re-activated the objects in the Development system.

  • Created a new transport request with the activated objects.

  • Re-transported it to Quality, but the issue persists.

Request for Input

Has anyone encountered a similar issue where BRF+ objects become inactive in the target system after transport? Any insights on:

  • Ensuring BRF+ objects retain their active status post-transport?

  • Best practices for BRF+ transport and activation?

  • Any missing configurations that could cause this behaviour?

Any guidance or solutions from the SAP Community would be greatly appreciated. Looking forward to your expert suggestions!

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Dynamic Workflow BAdI in IF_USMD_SSW_SYST_METHOD_CALLER is not working
entry.content:
Hello

I am implementing a dynamic workflow using a System Method BAdI. I have already created a service name and assigned it as a filter value in the BAdI.

(The other code reads data from the change request and I am only permitted to share the condition code below.) Here is the code within the BAdI:

 CONSTANTS:
    lc_action_approve TYPE usmd_crequest_action VALUE '03',
    lc_action_reject  TYPE usmd_crequest_action VALUE '04'.

*Check MBRSH
  CASE ls_material-mbrsh.
    WHEN 'M'.
      ev_action = lc_action_reject.
    WHEN OTHERS.
      ev_action = lc_action_approve
      .
  ENDCASE.

I have placed a debugger within the code, and I can confirm that the condition is being evaluated. However, after the system processes ev_action (e.g., lc_action_approve), the workflow does not proceed to the next step. Conversely, if ev_action equals lc_action_reject, the M2 step is not triggered.

Thank you!

Best regards,

Rei

Filter ValueNon User agent TableService NameSingle Value Table

entry.title: "MDG: Custom BRF+ Application & Function Configured for Activity Determination in Change Request — N
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am working on SAP MDG and facing an issue in Activity Determination for Change Requests.

I have configured my own Custom BRF+ Application and Function for Activity Determination under the path:

SPRO → MOC → Change Request → Configure Properties of Change Request Step → Create Change Request - Activity Determination using Decision Table.

In my configuration:

I have created a Custom BRF+ Application.

Developed a Function (Mode: Functional Mode).

Created a Decision Table for determining the Activity based on conditions like Change Request Type, Material Type, etc.

Assigned the BRF+ Function in the respective configuration under SPRO.

But when I create a Change Request in MDG, the system is not triggering my BRF+ application and not determining the Activity automatically.

It is directly taking the default Activity, and I am not getting any errors in SLG1 logs also.

Can anyone help me with:
What could be missing in this configuration?

Any prerequisite settings or checks required?

How to debug or trace whether the BRF+ function is being called?

Any Exit or BADI involvement in this scenario?

Thanks in advance for your help and suggestions.

entry.title: How to migrate settings for enabling Versioning in decision table to QA?
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

   I have a BRF plus decision table in ECC.

   The business users want to check change history where they want to see which user has added a new record or updated a record in teh decision table. So for this i opened the decision table in BRF workbench and swiched on versioning under General tab

I want to do the same (swich on versioning) in QA system as well. However i don't have developer access in QA. 

Therefore i tried to transport the same using customizing request. But it adds the entire FDT000 table data in the TR.

After migration i get error:  

Not released:Error in pre-export methods for request XXXXXXX

BRF+: Object changed after write to transport

What am I doing wrong? What is the correct way to migrate the versioning ON settings to QA?  

 Thanks

Gopal

Thanks,

Arindam Sur

entry.title: BRF+ updates to AMT_DOCCUR aren't reflected in IT_CURRENCYAMOUNT, leading to posting, but unchanged.
entry.content:
Hi Gurus,

Issue with BRF+ Integration in BAPI_ACC_DOCUMENT_POST – AMT_DOCCUR Not Updated. 

While integrating BRF+ with the BAPI - BAPI_ACC_DOCUMENT_POST, we attempted to modify the local currency amount (AMT_DOCCUR) dynamically using BRF+ rules. The logic was executed successfully, and the modified amount was correctly calculated within the BRF+ expression.

However, the issue arises during data mapping—specifically, when assigning the updated amount to the internal table IT_CURRENCYAMOUNT, which is a mandatory input structure for the BAPI.

Despite the updated value being present in the BRF+ output (e.g., a formula or ruleset), it is not getting transferred or passed into the IT_CURRENCYAMOUNT table during runtime. As a result, the BAPI call proceeds with the original amount (or an empty one), and the posting completes without reflecting the intended amount change.

Please let me know if you need anything else. Thank you so much for your quick response in advance.

Thanks again,

Rachna

entry.title: BRF+ S4/HANA 2025 BADI code ABAP for key users
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

I'm implementing the SD_APM_SET_APPROVAL_REASON badi.

When implementing the badi, it tells me that the ABAP model for key users should be used.

For this badi, a BRF was implemented as the decision-making model.

My issue is that when I try to execute the BRF within the badi, I get the following message:

The use of Class CL_FDT_FUNCTION_PROCESS is not permitted.

I've searched some forums, but they refer to the CL_FDT_FUNCTION_PROCESS_API.

But it doesn't exist on my system.

I've also tried generating a class that inherits from CL_FDT_FUNCTION_PROCESS, but it's defined as final, so I can't inherit its properties.

Is there any other way to run the BRF from the ABAP code for key users?

entry.title: Adding a new relationship category to BRF+/OPD?
entry.content:
Hello,

I'm currently working on a BRF+ project, where I'm tasked to edit the "OPD_V3_BILLING_DOCUMENT" to make the Receiver Decision Table include a new result column.

The problem arises when I try to add the new result column, as the Decision Table no longer follows SAP's template, I've tried to change the Result Data Object but that still sends errors:

 

the two errors are APOC_OC_CONFIG0101 and APOC_OC_CONFIG108.

The errors doesn't appear when I create my own Decision Table unless it share its name with one of standard SAP Decision Tables, but that isn't a solution as it then no longer appears in the OPD.

So my question is: How can I create a new Result Column without creating errors? and if that isn't an option, is there a way for me to make a new Decision Table and have that appear in the OPD?

Thanks in advance

entry.title: Is BRF+ integrated with SAP Flexible Workflow for dynamic agent determination?
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I'd like to understand whether SAP Flexible Workflow provides a standard/configurable integration with BRF+ for dynamic agent determination based on business rules, or if the only available approach is to invoke BRF+ through an agent determination BAdI such MMPUR_WORKFLOW_AGENTS_V2?

Any guidance would be appreciated.

Thanks,
Mustafa.

Thanks,

entry.title: Output using BRF+ for order confirmation
entry.content:
Output management in SAP S/4HANA governs the generation and distribution of business
documents, such as order confirmations, invoices, and delivery notes. With the advent of
S/4HANA, SAP introduced a new framework for output management leveraging the
Business Rule Framework Plus (BRF+), replacing the traditional NACE-based approach.
This new mechanism provides greater flexibility, improved user experience, and better
integration capabilities. Below is a comprehensive guide to configuring output
management for order confirmation using BRF+.
This documents provides a step by step guide to setup output using BRF+ for order
confirmation.
Step 1: Activate S/4HANA Output Management
Ensure that the output management functionality is activated in the system. This is done by
verifying the system configuration in SPRO:
Path: SPRO > Cross-Application Components > Output Control > Activate Output
Management.
Step 2: Define Output Types
Navigate to the relevant configuration to define output types for sales documents:
Path: SPRO > > Cross-Application Components > Output Control > Define Output Types.

Copy the standard and create new output

3: Assign output channels
Path: SPRO > > Cross-Application Components > Output Control > Assign Output
ChannelsCopyOUTPUT)

Step 4: Define Rules for Determination of Master Form Template
Path: SPRO > > Cross-Application Components > Output Control > Define Rules for
Determination

Click on new entries
And enter the details as below

Step 5: Assign Form Templates
Path: SPRO > > Cross-Application Components > Output Control > Assign Form
Tem

Organization ID = company code Org
unit Type = Sales Org (VKORG) Org
Unit ID= SAGR (Sales org)

Click on new entries and enter the below

Form Template: SD_SLS_ORDER_CONFIRM (Standard)
Step 6: Define Business rules for output Parameter determination
Path: SPRO > > Cross-Application Components > Output Control > Define Business rules
for Output Upon clicking on it new web page will be opened

Parameter determination Step1:
Determination

Click on Edit and add new

Sales Org 

Document Category C

Sales Order Type

Dispatch Time: 1 Immediate
Upon entering all the details, click on activate

Parameter determination Step2:
Determination Step: Receiver

Click on Edit and new entries
New row will be populated. Enter the valuesRole=o/p

Upon entering the details, click on activate

Output Parameter determination Step3: Determination
Step: Channel
Click & edit and new entries

No role is needed as we gave AG in Receiver

Upon entering the details click on activate

Output Parameter determination Step 4: Determination
step: printer settings

Click on edit and new entries 

Number of copies=1

Upon entering the details, click on activate

Output Parameters determination step 5:
Determination Step: Form Template 

Click on edit and click on ‘+’ new entries 

Upon entering all the detail like

Output type, Form template CLICK ON ACTIVATE

Output Parameters determination step 6:
Determination Step: Output Relevance 

Click on edit and click on ‘+’ add new entries. New row will be populated and add the
required entries

entry.title: S/4HANA Public Cloud – Is it possible to add a 4th Receiver Role in Billing Document Output
entry.content:
Hello SAP Experts,

We are working on Billing Document Output Management in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud using BRF+ (Manage Output Determination Apps).

In Receiver determination (DT_RECEIVER), the system allows only the following standard roles for Billing Document:

  • RE (Bill-to Party)

  • AG (Sold-to Party)

  • RG (Payer)

Our business requirement is to print 4 copies of the Billing Invoice (Original, Duplicate, Triplicate, and Extra Copy).

We checked if an additional receiver role (for example, a 4th role or custom role) can be added in Output Management, but Public Cloud does not seem to support custom partner roles.

Question:

  • Is it technically possible in S/4HANA Public Cloud to add a 4th receiver role for Billing Document output determination?

  • If not, is the only supported approach to handle multiple invoice copies inside a single Adobe Form?

Any official confirmation or SAP note reference would be very helpful.

Thanks in advance.
